moves.1. d4: again I take my normal london game approach
moves.1... e6 2. Nf3 f6 3. Bf4 g5: black starts looking for a strange defesive pawn formation
moves.6... Bb7 7. Nbd2: normal development and eases pressure on knight (no doubles pawns)
moves.7... Bb4 8. c3 Ba5 9. b4: squeeze blacks space and push bishop away
moves.9... Bb6 10. O-O: White castled and almost finished development and has great advantage in tempo
moves.10... f5 11. Be5: instead of retreating (h3) decided to attack rook
moves.13... Ke7: not quite sure about the thoughts here?
moves.14. Be5 d6 15. Bg3: at this point white looking to get bishop on h5 winning the queen if can rid the knight
moves.15... Kd7 16. Re1: plan is lost put white adds support to the center and looks to advance e pawn
moves.16... Qf8 17. Be2: white not happy about blacks light coloured bishop - so looks work way round to a trade
moves.18. Nh4: white looks to rid the light bishops
moves.19... Ne7: another strange move by black as forces king into a corner
moves.23. exf5 e5: pawn passed - instead of locking center white wants to create an explosive finish
moves.28... Rxe1+: its taken leaving black with no rooks
moves.30... Qd2 31. Re8: final attack if pawn hadnt made room would of spely disaster for white
moves.35. Bxf2+ Qxf2+: goes out killing his queen - true scottish style!!
